project.description:
This project will build WebObjects projects (both Frameworks and Applications) that are based on Project Wonder. You can specify the version of Apple WebObjects™ to use, the repository and branch for your project and the repository and branch for Project Wonder.

You can also specify you want a Test Build (no embedded frameworks) or a Deployment Build (fully embedded WebObjects and Project Wonder Frameworks)

You can use this project as a template for your own projects, or simply specify the parameters at runtime.

NOTE: this project is meant to work in tandem with the InstallWOAndWOnder Jenkins job. That job will take care of downloading and installing WebObjects™ and cloning, building and installing Project WOnder so that they are available for this job to use.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: PROJECT_NAME
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: This is the name of the directory that contains the WebObjects application project that you want to build, i.e., the directory that contains the Sources, Components and Resources subdirectories). To specify frameworks that this application depends upon and should be built as part of this job then you will need to add additional Ant Tasks. Depending on your source code repository structure you may also need to add additional SCM to check them out into the "Projects" directory as well.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: DEPLOYED_APPLICATION_NAME
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: This setting allows you to specify a different name for an Application when it is built. You must specify a value, even if it is the same as the PROJECT_NAME parameter above.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: PROJECT_SVN_REPOSITORY
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: The SVN repository that holds the project you want to build.

hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.name: PROJECT_BRANCHES_TAGS_TRUNK
hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.description: Select either "branches/", "tags/" or "trunk". If you select branches, then you must also specify a branch. If you select "Trunk" then the branch parameter MUST BE BLANK.

hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.name: BUILD_TYPE
hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.description:
• Test Build will override the settings defined in WOLips and will not embed any frameworks in the built application, it will only link to them.
  • Deployment will obey the Deployment settings you defined for the project in WOLips, which should almost certainly be to embed both System and Local frameworks.

hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.name: WO_VERSION
hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.description: This is the version of Apple™ WebObjects that you want to build against. It must have been already downloaded and installed in Jenkin's WOFrameworksRepository (JENKINS_HOME/WOFrameworkRepository). The easiest way to do this is by cloning and running the InstallWOAndWOnder Jenkins job.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: WONDER_GIT_REFERENCE
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: This is the branch of Wonder that you want to build against. This branch of Project WOnder must have been already built and installed in Jenkin's WOFrameworksRepository. The easiest way to do this is by cloning and running the InstallWOAndWOnder Jenkins job.
